definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to run away in the confusion/to take advantage of the confusion to escape

sentences.english: The insect found itself entangled in an inextricable net.
sentences.chinese: 昆蟲發現自己被纏在一個逃脫不掉的羅網中。

sentences.english: He called it a narrow escape. But it was really a cliff-hanger .
sentences.chinese: 他稱之爲僥倖逃脫，但那確實讓他膽戰心驚。

sentences.english: Fixed not being able to escape from map editor menus after applying options.
sentences.chinese: 固定不能夠逃脫地圖編輯器菜單後應用選項。

sentences.english: We need to stop letting our Congress and the President get away withthe crimes their getting away with.
sentences.chinese: 不要再讓國會和總統逃脫出他們該受到的制裁。

sentences.english: They watched him closely in cottom he should escape.
sentences.chinese: 他們嚴密監視他，恐怕他會逃脫。

sentences.english: When the police arrived , the robbers had scrambled out of the windows.
sentences.chinese: 當警察到達時，強盜們匆忙從窗口逃脫。

sentences.english: Graham joined the army to get away from a boring job.
sentences.chinese: 格雷厄姆參軍以逃脫煩悶的工作。

sentences.english: King Goodness told him the story of his escape from the band of jackals.
sentences.chinese: 大仁慈王告訴他自己是如何逃脫胡狼的圍攻。

sentences.english: The masterminds of the prospiracy to help the refugees escape were themselves former refugees.
sentences.chinese: 難民逃脫計劃的策劃人自己本身之前就是難民。

sentences.english: Only the old lady Kung escaped.
No one of us can get out of the space and time of life.
sentences.chinese: 誰也不能逃脫生命的空間和時間。

sentences.english: His predecessor Bill Clinton did not escape "criticism from Confucius" either.
sentences.chinese: 他的前任克林頓也沒能逃脫來自孔子的“諄諄教誨”。

sentences.english: Why do we so often blow out our candles and let the darkness escape to cover up a portion of our glow?
sentences.chinese: 爲何我們要吹熄我們的蠟燭讓黑暗逃脫來掩蓋光明。

sentences.english: It was his efforts that allowed the scouts to escape.
sentences.chinese: 在他的努力下，那支偵察隊才得以逃脫。

sentences.english: They killed the remaining Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day.
sentences.chinese: 殺了逃脫剩下的亞瑪力人，就住在那裏直到今日。

definition: to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
